Module it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher
Package it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher.server.network

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.triton.launcher.server.network.Server
public class Server extends Object
This class utilizes the Singleton pattern; It must be instantiated only once.

  • Field Details

    • LOGGER

      public static final Logger LOGGER
      The constant LOGGER for printing information on the terminal.

    • CLIENTS_CONNECTED

      private static final String CLIENTS_CONNECTED
      For removing duplicated code.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • instance

      private static Server instance
      This variable is necessary to implement the Singleton Pattern.

    • port

      private final int port
      The port is initialized by ServerApp.

    • waitingList

      private final List<VirtualView> waitingList
      A list containing virtualView's players. It is useful to handle connections and create a lobby.

    • controller

      private Controller controller
      Server need to have a reference to Controller, so it can create Virtual Views and Game.

    • listening

      private boolean listening
      Listening is true, so the server can accept new connections with clients

    • starting

      private boolean starting
      Starting is true when the first player enter a correct game mode and number of players.

    • started

      private boolean started
      Started is true when the beginGame() method is called, i.e. when the Game has started.

    • expertMode

      private boolean expertMode
      This boolean allows Server's methods to easily access the gameMode entered by the first player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      private Server(int port)

  • Method Details

    • instance

      public static Server instance(int port)
      Realize the Singleton Pattern in order to instantiate the Server Class only once.
      Parameters:
      port - the port passed by ServerApp, the latter instantiates Server.
      Returns:
      the Server instance

    • run

      public void run() throws IOException
      If something goes wrong in the try branch, it automatically closes the Server Socket. Otherwise, it accepts connections from Clients.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • lobby

      public void lobby(ServeOneClient serveOneClient, String username)
      This method is called by ServeOneClient. Creates the Virtual View for the Client, then it adds it in the waiting list to manage connections. If the number of players has reached the maximum (3), no more users can be connected, thus it sends an error message and removes the player from Waiting List. IllegalArgumentException is thrown when a user enters a username that has already been chosen.
      Parameters:
      serveOneClient - the serve one client
      username - the username

    • activateGame

      public void activateGame(ServeOneClient serveOneClient, int maxNumPlayers, boolean expertMode)
      This method is called when the first player decides the max number of players. If the number is not correct, it sends an error message to the first player and re-asks the number of players. Otherwise, it creates the Game, the Controller, and sets the VirtualView of first player as an observer of the Controller.
      Parameters:
      maxNumPlayers - decided by the first player
      expertMode - the expert mode

    • addObserverRelationships

      private void addObserverRelationships(VirtualView virtualView)

    • addPlayerAndSendSuccessMessage

      private void addPlayerAndSendSuccessMessage(VirtualView virtualView, String username) throws IllegalArgumentException
      If the just accepted player is not the first and the first player has not chosen the number of student, this method sends a message saying that the Game will start soon.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - for sending a Login Reply Message when the addGamePlayer method did not throw an exception.
      username - of the player to add in the Game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the username is already chosen

    • askSettingsIfMinimumNumberOfPlayersIsReached

      private void askSettingsIfMinimumNumberOfPlayersIsReached()
      If the least number of players for starting the Game are connected, ask the first player number of players and game mode.

    • beginGameIfSettingsAreSet

      private void beginGameIfSettingsAreSet()
      If the number of players connected is 3 and the first player chose the mode and the number of players, the game must start. In order to start the game, it is necessary to ask the first player the Tower Color. Eventually, the waiting list has to be cleared up, because there are no more users that can play the game.

    • sendErrorMessageAndRemoveFromWaitingList

      private void sendErrorMessageAndRemoveFromWaitingList(VirtualView virtualView)
      Sends a Full Lobby Error Message to the last user who tried to connect. Removes the Virtual View from the waiting list because the user cannot connect.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - of the last user who tried to connect.

    • removeFromLobbyBecauseUsernameAlreadyChosen

      private void removeFromLobbyBecauseUsernameAlreadyChosen(VirtualView virtualView)
      Sends an error message and removes user's Virtual View from waiting list and Controller.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - to send the message and remove

    • isNumberOfPlayersValid

      private boolean isNumberOfPlayersValid(int num)

    • askFirstPlayerGameSettingsAgain

      private void askFirstPlayerGameSettingsAgain()
      Tell the player they entered a wrong number. Then, ask again game mode and number of players.

    • beginGameOrRemoveExtraPlayer

      private void beginGameOrRemoveExtraPlayer(int maxNumPlayers)
      If the number of players in the Controller (or equivalently in Game) is equal to maxNumPlayers entered by the first player, it starts the game. Otherwise, it removes the extra player. After disconnection, the Game will automatically begin because starting is true.
      Parameters:
      maxNumPlayers - chosen by the first player

    • removePlayer

      private void removePlayer(VirtualView virtualView)

    • acceptClientConnection

      private void acceptClientConnection(ServerSocket serverSocket)
      It creates a Server Socket setting a timeout of 6 minutes (=360'000 secs). In other words, the connection with client is closed after 6 minutes. Then, it instantiates and starts a thread to manage the Server Socket that will be assigned to the Client.
      Parameters:
      serverSocket - created by run() method

    • notifyVirtualView

      public void notifyVirtualView(ServeOneClient serveOneClient, ClientMessage message)
      Notify the virtual view associated with the specific ServeOneClient
      Parameters:
      serveOneClient - the ServeOneClient class that receives messages from the Client
      message - the message from Client

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(ServeOneClient soc)
      Disconnect.
      Parameters:
      soc - the soc

    • disconnectPlayer

      public void disconnectPlayer(VirtualView virtualView)
      Disconnect player.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - the virtual view of the player

    • resetPlayer

      public void resetPlayer(VirtualView virtualView)
      Reset player.
      Parameters:
      virtualView - the vv

    • disconnectAllPlayers

      public void disconnectAllPlayers()
      Disconnect all players.

    • removeObserverRelationships

      private void removeObserverRelationships(VirtualView virtualView)

    • beginGame

      public void beginGame(boolean expertMode)
      Begin game.
      Parameters:
      expertMode - the expert mode

    • resetServer

      public void resetServer()
      Reset server.
